item.title: Typewriter Keyboard
item.description: This is a mechanical keyboard build (DZ60 PCB, Kailh Box Navy switches) that uses as its keycaps real keys from old typewriters. I used three different sets of vintage typewriter keys.

item.title: Custom Keyboard Layout
item.description: It’s no secret that I’m massively obsessed with mechanical keyboards. For sheer customizability, they’re impossible to beat. Yes, I can put a lot of effort into software key remappings and then carefully port them over to every new computer I use – or I can just use open-source keyboard firmware QMK and my keyboard will work wherever I plug it in.
